intro: Dorstenia tayloriana var. tayloriana, commonly known as the Taylor's false arrowhead, is a striking member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique, spiraling leaves that resemble the shape of an arrowhead, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in panicles. Native to the tropical regions of Central America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a sought-after specimen for collectors and botanists interested in its morphological adaptations.
